text: Here's how to transfer your pictures
from your iPhone to both a Mac
and a Windows 10 computer.
Use the clickable sections below
to keep track of what steps you're on
in this tutorial.

First, connect your iPhone
to your Mac via USB.
Enter your phone's passcode
and, if prompted, trust your device.
Open the photos app on your computer
if it doesn't open automatically.
Select your iPhone in the sidebar
on the left under "Devices."

You should see an import
screen in the photos app

that shows the pictures
you have in your iPhone.

After the photos app opens
the pictures in your phone,

choose where you want to
store your imported pictures.
At the top of the window,
you'll see a drop-down menu
that lets you import your pictures
to one of your albums
or create a new album for your import.
There are two buttons in the upper left
of the import window.

"Import All New Items"
will transfer every photo
you have taken since your last import.
To only upload certain pictures,

click on each photo you want
to copy onto your computer
and then click "Import Selected."
After you've connected your phone via USB

and trusted your device,
click the start button.

Choose "Photos" from
the menu that pops up.
In photos, click "Import"
and select "From a connected device"
in the top right corner.

After your computer
has scanned your iPhone
for photos and videos, select your iPhone.
If your iPhone isn't detected,

make sure that your Apple
mobile device driver is updated.
Select the photos you want to import,
then click "Import items"

to choose where your
photos will be stored.
